[ Senior Software Engineer - Full stack T24/T25 ]

â€¢ Minimum of 5+ years of experience

â€¢ Experience in Node.js development using Express.js, Koa.js or other frameworks

â€¢ Expert knowledge in Java, Spring framework, REST, gRPC

â€¢ Experienced with asynchronous patterns and messaging frameworks (e.g. Kafka)

â€¢ Familiarity with other languages and technologies development, including Node, Hadoop, Spark, NoSQL Databases.

â€¢ Experience in various architecture design patterns, design and implementation of Financial Systems/Platforms such as Core Banking, Back-end Payment Hubs, Financial reconciliation and reporting

â€¢ Expertise in designing for reliability, availability, scalability and performance in highly regulated Financial Services industry preferred.

â€¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

â€¢ Ability to create structure and drive progress in an ambiguous environment

â€¢ Superb communication skills; ability to comfortably interact with tech and non-tech colleagues

â€¢ Demonstrated ability to scope, create and successfully deploy new strategy/ initiatives / capabilities

â€¢ Experience to interact with engineering teams from multiple geo-locations

â€¢ Fluent communicate in English

â€¢ Experience with front-end frameworks a plus



[ Senior Software Engineer-Backend T24/25 ]
Minimum of 5+ years of experience

â€¢ Expert knowledge in Java, Spring framework, REST, gRPC

â€¢ Experienced with asynchronous patterns and messaging frameworks (e.g. Kafka)

â€¢ Familiarity with other languages and technologies development, including Node, Hadoop, Spark, NoSQL Databases.

â€¢ Experience in various architecture design patterns, design and implementation of Financial Systems/Platforms such as Core Banking, Back-end Payment Hubs, Financial reconciliation and reporting

â€¢ Expertise in designing for reliability, availability, scalability and performance in highly regulated Financial Services industry preferred.

â€¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

â€¢ Ability to create structure and drive progress in an ambiguous environment

â€¢ Superb communication skills; ability to comfortably interact with tech and non-tech colleagues

â€¢ Demonstrated ability to scope, create and successfully deploy new strategy/ initiatives / capabilities

â€¢ Experience to interact with engineering teams from multiple geo-locations

â€¢ Fluent communicate in English

â€¢ Experience with front-end frameworks a plus

â€¢ Experience in Node.js development using Express.js, Koa.js or other frameworks a plus



[ Senior Software Engineer-Frontend T24/25 ]
Minimum of 5+ years' hands-on experience developing software

Good programming capabilities in JavaScript

Rich Experiences in HTML5/CSS3

Good programming capabilities in at least one of React/Vue/Angular framework

Deep experiences on UE and UI

Front end Architecture/Performance Tuning/Safety Optimization will be a big plus

Hybrid/mobile experience will be a big plus

Innovative, passionate, and teamworking. Start-up spirited!

Excellent communication skills in English.

We take pride in our two platforms WOO X, a pioneering crypto exchange dedicated to transparency and trustworthiness, and WOOFi, a top 15 DEX by 24-hour volume. å·¥ä½œç§¯æä¸»åŠ¨ï¼Œæœ‰è¾ƒå¼ºçš„å›¢é˜Ÿåˆä½œç²¾ç¥ï¼Œèƒ½è‡ªæˆ‘é©±åŠ¨çªç ´éš¾å…³å’Œè§£å†³é—®é¢˜

2 ã€Flutter Mobile Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Implementation of product roadmap for iOS and Android application.

Build, deploy and test applications and release them to the Google Play Store.

Maintaining existing application for possible fixes & performance improvements.

Coordinating with the Cloud/Mobile/Embedded/Design teams in solving problems, creating ideas, and improving UX.

Writing readable & reusable code while fulfilling expected documentation standards & coverage.

Developing a "bullet-proof Software Development Kit" with the rest of the team for the different platforms.

Why work with us:

Join us in realising our vision in advancing decentralisation, and leading innovation in CeFi and DeFi. Enjoy work flexibility, a supportive team, and an environment that nurtures your ideas. Plus, expect a performance-based annual bonus for all contributors at WOO ğŸ’ª

About you:

More than 1 year of Flutter development experience.

Proficient in using various components of Flutter, such as: basic components, layout components, container components, scrollable components, functional components. Proficient in using Flutter's state management, global state management, and routing management.

Familiar with Flutter's gestures, animations, WebSockets, internationalization.

Familiar with Flutter's CustomPaint and Canvas.

Familiar with Flutter's package management, as well as the App Store and Play Store publishing process.

Solid understanding of Dart language.

Have own understanding of page rendering performance optimization under high frequency data refresh.

Experience with complete Flutter projects is preferred.

3 ã€Senior Frontend Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Developing WOO X web products that support digital asset trading. Participating in building up innovative tools to enrich the ecosystem of our products. Optimising the process of development, performance and user experience continuously. Why work with us:

Join us in realising our vision in advancing decentralisation, and leading innovation in CeFi and DeFi. Enjoy work flexibility, a supportive team, and an environment that nurtures your ideas. Plus, expect a performance-based annual bonus for all contributors at WOO ğŸ’ª

About you:

Minimum of 3 years of frontend development experience and familiarity with React.js. Proficient in JavaScript, CSS, HTML and ES6. Familiar with real-time data processing methods, such as Websocket and RxJs, and able to detect potential performance issues. Knowledge of blockchain/crypto service or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus. You enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the 'what', but also the 'why'. Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

4 ã€Senior DevOps Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Monitoring our exchange service status, refining the deployment pipeline, monitoring, troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of issues. Focusing on ensuring the stability of the service and helping the Engineering team to deploy features to production. Handling and solving issues when service goes wrong. Designing a better deployment pipeline. Building tools to monitor systems and identify issues. Why work with us:

Join us in realising our vision in advancing decentralisation, and leading innovation in CeFi and DeFi. Enjoy work flexibility, a supportive team, and an environment that nurtures your ideas. Plus, expect a performance-based annual bonus for all contributors at WOO ğŸ’ª

About you:

(Must) Familiar with one of the IaC tools such as Terraform or Ansible.

(Must) Familiar with one of the cloud providers such as GCP, AWS or Azure.

(Must) Familiar with Kubernetes, Helm and Docker Familiar with one of GitOps such as ArgoCD.

Familiar with one of the monitoring systems such as Prometheus and Grafana.

Familiar with one of the logging systems Loki or ELK.

Familiar with one of MQ tools such as RocketMQ Familiar with one of the cache tools such as Redis.

Familiar with one of SQL/NoSQL databases such as MySQL or Mongo.

Familiar with one of the programming languages such as Python or Golang.

Nice to have! - Security-related experience.

24/7 on-call when there are urgent issues to handle and must be handled in a timely + a responsible manner. Knowledge of the blockchain/crypto domain or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus. Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

body {
min-width: 820px;
font-family: -apple-system-font, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Helvetica Neue", "PingFang SC", "Hiragino Sans GB", "Microsoft YaHei UI", "Microsoft YaHei", Arial, sans-serif;
}

#Wrapper {
padding: 0 env(safe-area-inset-right) 0 env(safe-area-inset-left);
text-align: center;
background-color: #f5f5f5;
background-image:none;
}
#Top {
text-align: center;
height: 48px;
font-size: 15px;
font-weight: 500;
border-bottom: none;
padding: 0 20px 0 20px;
--tw-bg-opacity: 1;
--tw-shadow: 0 1px 2px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, .05);
--tw-shadow-colored: 0 1px 2px 0 var(--tw-shadow-color);
--bs-bg-opacity: 1;
background-color: rgb(255 255 255 / var(--tw-bg-opacity));
background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, var(--bs-bg-opacity));
background-color: rgba(var(--bs-white-rgb), var(--bs-bg-opacity));
box-shadow: 0 0 #0000, 0 0 #0000, var(--tw-shadow);
box-shadow: var(--tw-ring-offset-shadow, 0 0 #0000), var(--tw-ring-shadow, 0 0 #0000), var(--tw-shadow);
box-shadow: 0 .125rem .25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, .075);
box-shadow: var(--bs-box-shadow-sm)
}
.content {
max-width: 80rem;
margin: 0 auto 0 auto;
}
.cell {
padding: 10px;
font-size: 14px;
line-height: 150%;
text-align: left;
border-bottom: 1px solid #f0f0f0a3;
}
td[width="48"][valign="top"][align="center"] {
display: none;
}
#Top>.content {
max-width: 77rem;
}
a.topic-link:active, a.topic-link:link {
color: #000;
}
.topic_content {
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 2.0;
color: var(--box-foreground-color);
word-break: break-word;
}
.reply_content {
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 1.6;
color: var(--box-foreground-color);
word-break: break-word;
}
.topic_info {
font-size: 12px;
color: var(--color-fade);
line-height: 200%;
opacity: 0.3;
}

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] æ‹›äººï¼Œç‰©æµè¡Œä¸šï¼ŒåæŠ€æœ¯
item.content:encoded:
å·¥ä½œåœ°ç‚¹
é¦™æ¸¯ä¹é¾™æ¹¾

å…¬å¸æä¾›ç­¾è¯

æœ‰æ„è€…ç•™ä¸‹é‚®ç®±æˆ‘æ¥å†…æ¨

Sea Logistics Systems and Process Order Management Expert

You will be part of our Process and Systems team, adding your expertise and skills to the delivery of Customer and Operational Excellence.
Your Role

Your primary objective is to design and execute technical solutions for customer-facing systems, as well as to continuously improve our existing processes and systems to refine the International Supply Chain (ISC) landscape.
Your Responsibilities

Lead the successful completion of all Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) and Application Programming Interface (API) customer integration projects.
Develop, document, implement and provide initial training for customer-specific systems.
Ensure all integrations are End-to-End (E2E) tested with our Transport Management Systems (TMS) and other systems in the ecosystem.
Support the Digital Solution teams to lead technical conversations with customers to understand EDI requirements.
Provide timely origin support for order management systems KN ESP and InforNexus.
Oversee origin order systems training, offering guidance to national process and systems teams for end-user standard system training.
Align processes and implementations of order systems with corporate strategy, identify gaps, provide feedback, and test and communicate new features and bug fixes to our countries.
Collaborate with various ISC teams to enhance product strategy, support solution design and implementations, and co-create action plans to improve origin performance.

Your Skills and Experiences

Fluent in English
Very good communication skills, being an expert in bridging the gap between IT (Developers), support teams, national/branch operations, other regions/counterparts in corporate functions.
Confidence of talking to bigger audiences
Occasional travel might be required
Flexibility / late night calls expected to join for global calls
Education in Logistics/Forwarding and/or IT related Studies is a must
Alternative experience working in similar roles in Logistics/Forwarding companies

item.title: [åˆ†äº«åˆ›é€ ] SAT Score Calculator: Your Ultimate SAT Prep Tool
item.content:encoded:
The SAT Score Calculator is a user-friendly app designed to help students estimate their SAT scores based on their raw performance in practice tests. By inputting the number of correct answers from the Reading and Writing and Math sections, students can receive a quick, estimated SAT score. This tool simulates the actual SAT scoring method, providing a total score out of 1600. It's a valuable resource for tracking progress, targeting study efforts, and understanding performance in different areas. https://satscorecalculator.app

Why Use the SAT Score Calculator?

Preparing for the SAT involves more than just memorizing formulas and vocabulary. Effective preparation means understanding where you stand and identifying areas to improve. This is where the SAT Score Calculator becomes invaluable. By allowing students to enter raw scores (correct answers) for each section, it quickly provides an estimated scaled score. This gives students insights into how close they are to reaching their target scores and helps them adjust their study plans.

Key Features

  1. Accurate Score Estimation: By using raw scores, the calculator offers a close approximation of official SAT scores, helping students realistically gauge their readiness.
  2. Section-by-Section Breakdown: It offers a breakdown of scores for the Reading and Writing and Math sections, so students can focus on areas needing improvement.
  3. Adaptable to Digital SAT: Designed with the new digital SAT format in mind, the calculator aligns with recent testing changes, making it more accurate for current test-takers.
  4. Quick and User-Friendly Interface: With a simple design, students can input answers easily and get instant results, saving time and effort in manual calculations.
  5. Free Access: The SAT Score Calculator is available at no cost, making it accessible to all students preparing for the SAT.

How It Works

The SAT Score Calculator functions by converting raw scoresâ€”the number of correct answersâ€”into a scaled score between 200 and 800 for each section. Students receive a combined total score out of 1600, which aligns with the official SAT scoring scale. This process simulates the actual SAT scoring method, giving students an accurate idea of their potential performance on test day.

Use Cases

  • Tracking Practice Test Progress: By entering scores from practice tests, students can monitor improvements over time.
  • Targeted Study Planning: Section scores allow students to pinpoint specific areas that need extra focus.
  • Instant Feedback: The calculator provides an immediate score, helping students get quick feedback after a mock exam.
  • Confidence Building: By seeing a clear path to improvement, students can feel more prepared and confident as test day approaches. https://satscorecalculator.app

The SAT Score Calculator is a powerful, no-cost tool for students aiming to achieve their best possible SAT score. It helps remove the guesswork from practice tests, empowering students with the insights they need to excel. Try it today to make the most out of your SAT preparation!

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] Follow is looking for Growth Marketing Specialists and Operation Specialists
item.content:encoded:
Follow - Next-Gen Information Browser

Homepage: https://follow.is/

GitHub: https://github.com/RSSNext/follow

Twitter: https://x.com/follow_app_

Natural Selection Labs

We are a globally distributed organization: all of our members come from different countries, including US, Canada, UK, China, Japan, Singapore, New Zealand, and Australia.

Our team is equal, open, and free. We advocate flexible working hours, so both early birds and night owls are welcome!

Since our establishment, we have made significant progress and are incredibly proud of our team culture and atmosphere.

Operation Specialist

Your Role:

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for users, resolving issues and relaying feedback to improve the product.
  • Manage and engage our online community via Twitter, Discord, and other social platforms.
  • Communicate regularly with users through updates, polls, and newsletters to maintain engagement.
  • Identify and implement user growth strategies, working closely with the team to optimize acquisition and retention.

Who are you:

  • Followâ€™s user who believes its mission
  • Extensive experience with RSS readers
  • Proficient in multiple social media platforms (Twitter, Xiaohongshu, Reddit, Discord, etc.)
  • Has ample time and is eager to assist the follow community in solving various issues
  • Fluent in both Chinese and English

Growth Marketing Specialist

Your Role:

  • Develop and execute marketing strategies to drive user acquisition and engagement, with a focus on the English-speaking market, covering both web2 and web3.
  • Lead and manage campaigns across multiple channels, including influencer marketing, social media, SEO and others; produce high-quality, engaging content that resonates with our target audience.
  • Leverage your personal connections within the adjacent communities to create buzz and build relationships with influencers and partners.
  • Work with devs and other marketing members in a collaborative manner, and collectively make product decisions.

Who are you:

  • Followâ€™s user who believes its mission
  • Sufficient experience with RSS readers or similar products
  • Worked in marketing or related fields for more than 2 years, w/ proven experience in growing similar early-stage products.
  • Strong knowledge of influencer marketing, social media, with established connections in relevant communities; great communicator, writer and content producer.
  • Fluent in both English and Chinese
  • Optional: based in US; an influencer yourself (small-tier is enough) in related field

We offer:

  • A chance to directly participate in the Internet revolution and make the world a better place.
  • Opportunities to collaborate with the worldâ€™s top Open Web projects.
  • A team of loving and competent companions!
  • FULLY-REMOTE role with very flexible working hours.
  • An AWESOME & CARING company culture.
  • Competitive allowances and benefits.
  • We are committed to diversity and welcome talented applicants from all walks of life to apply! All applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, nationality, veteran or disability status.

Contact

We look forward to receiving your CV:

talent@rss3.io

item.title: [é—®ä¸ç­”] æ–°æ‰‹é—®ä¸€ä¸ª go å®ç°å¹¶å‘ç´ æ•°ç­›çš„é—®é¢˜
item.content:encoded:
• https://go.dev/play/p/CJSIHL3ycKG
func Filter(in <-chan int, out chan<- int, prime int) {
	for {
		i := <-in
		if i%prime != 0 {
			out <- i
		}
	}
}

func Generate(ch chan<- int) {
	for i := 2; ; i++ {
		ch <- i
	}
}

func main() {
	ch := make(chan int)
	go Generate(ch)
	// print the first 10 prime numbers
	for i := 0; i < 10; i++ {
		prime := <-ch
		println("next prime = ", prime)
		ch1 := make(chan int)
		go Filter(ch, ch1, prime)
		ch = ch1
	}
}
  • https://go.dev/play/p/q0NdUVMjArc
func Filter(in <-chan int, out chan<- int, prime int) {
	for {
		i := <-in
		if i%prime != 0 {
			out <- i
		}
	}
}

func main() {
	ch := make(chan int)
	go func() {
		for i := 2; ; i++ {
			ch <- i
		}
	}()

	for i := 0; i < 10; i++ {
		prime := <-ch
		println("next prime = ", prime)
		ch1 := make(chan int)
		go Filter(ch, ch1, prime)
		ch = ch1
	}
}

item.title: [ç¨‹åºå‘˜] SQL é—®é¢˜ä¿®æ”¹
item.content:encoded:
æ±‚å¤§ä½¬çœ‹ä¸‹æ€ä¹ˆæ”¹ï¼Œai é—®ä¸å‡ºæ¥ã€‚
æ‰§è¡Œä¼šå‡ºç° ï¼ˆ 1054 - Unknown column 'ai.record_node_history' in 'field list'ï¼‰ï¼Œ
è¯¥å­—æ®µå†è¡¨é‡Œæ˜¯æœ‰çš„ï¼Œå› ä¸º groupBy å­æŸ¥è¯¢å¯¼è‡´çš„å— ï¼Ÿ


SELECT ai.form_id AS formId
FROM approval_info ai
LEFT JOIN approval_config ac
ON ai.form_id = ac.form_id
AND ai.process_progress = ac.approval_node
WHERE
ac.corp_id = 'dayReport'
AND ai.end_state = 0
AND ai.launch_time >= '2024-10-01'
AND ai.launch_time <= '2024-10-31'
AND ai.process_progress != 0
AND FIND_IN_SET('liuys', ac.current_node_approver) > 0
AND NOT EXISTS (
SELECT 1
FROM approval_record ar
WHERE ar.approval_info_id = ai.approval_info_id
AND ar.approver_node != ai.process_progress
AND ar.accessory_url != ai.object_id
AND ar.approver_user_id = 'liuys'
AND ar.approver_count = (
SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM (
-- è®¡ç®— record_node_history ä¸­ process_progress å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°
SELECT SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(ai.record_node_history, ',', numbers.n), ',', -1) AS node
FROM (
SELECT 1 n UNION ALL SELECT 2 UNION ALL SELECT 3 UNION ALL SELECT 4
UNION ALL SELECT 5 UNION ALL SELECT 6 UNION ALL SELECT 7 UNION ALL SELECT 8
UNION ALL SELECT 9 UNION ALL SELECT 10
) numbers
WHERE CHAR_LENGTH(ai.record_node_history) - CHAR_LENGTH(REPLACE(ai.record_node_history, ',', '')) + 1 >= numbers.n
) AS temp
-- æ¯”è¾ƒ record_node_history ä¸­çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸å½“å‰ process_progress
WHERE temp.node = CAST(ai.process_progress AS CHAR)
)
)
ORDER BY ai.form_id
LIMIT 10 OFFSET 0;

item.title: [å®½å¸¦ç—‡å€™ç¾¤] NAT1 åˆ©ç”¨ LUCKY+è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–è„šæœ¬å®ç°æ— æ„ŸåŒ– PLEX å¤–ç½‘è®¿é—®
item.content:encoded:
æ•ˆæœ

èƒ½åœ¨æ²¡æœ‰å…¬ç½‘ï¼Œä»…æ‹¥æœ‰ NAT1 çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œåšåˆ°æ— æ„Ÿ PLEX å¤–ç½‘è®¿é—®

å‰æ

  • ç¡®ä¿è·¯ç”±å™¨çš„ NAT ç±»å‹ä¸º NAT1,å¹¶ä¸”è¦æ±‚ TCP çš„ NAT ç±»å‹ä¹Ÿä¸º NAT1
    • ä¸»è·¯ç”±åœºæ™¯ä¸‹åŸºæœ¬æ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆå¤§é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¦‚æœåœ¨æ—è·¯ç”±åœºæ™¯ä¸‹å¯èƒ½éœ€è¦ä¸ºæ—è·¯ç”±å¼€å¯ DMZ ï¼Œæ­¤å¤–ï¼ŒOpenclash ç­‰ç§‘å­¦æ’ä»¶ä¹Ÿæœ‰å½±å“
  • å®‰è£… Lucky ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œä¸å¤šèµ˜è¿°ï¼Œè‡ªè¡Œè§£å†³

ç›¸å…³é“¾æ¥

Lucky é¡¹ç›®åœ°å€ Python-plexapi

é…ç½®

è„šæœ¬é…ç½®

  • ä»¥ Openwrt ä¸ºä¾‹ï¼Œé¦–å…ˆç¡®ä¿å®‰è£… Python ï¼Œéšåå®‰è£…ä¸‹åˆ—åº“

pip3 install plexapi

  • æ ¹æ®å…¶ä¸­éœ€è¦ä¿®æ”¹çš„å››è¡Œä»£ç ï¼Œä¿®æ”¹ä¸ºè‡ªå·±çš„å®é™…å‚æ•°ï¼Œéšåå¤åˆ¶å¹¶å»ºç«‹ä¸€ä¸ª.py æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ modify_port.py ï¼Œæ”¾ç½®äºä»»æ„ä½ç½®ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚/root è·¯å¾„ä¸‹

è¿™æ˜¯éœ€è¦ä¿®æ”¹çš„å†…å®¹

# Plex è´¦å·ä¿¡æ¯
PLEX_USERNAME = "example@qq.com"
PLEX_PASSWORD = "password"

PLEX_SERVER_BASEURL = "http://192.168.3.6:32400"  # æ›¿æ¢ä¸ºä½ çš„ Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨ URL

TOKEN_FILE = "/root/plex_token.json"  # ä¿å­˜ PLEX Token çš„è·¯å¾„

è¿™æ˜¯è„šæœ¬ä»£ç 

import os
import sys
import json
import requests
from plexapi.server import PlexServer

# Plex è´¦å·ä¿¡æ¯
PLEX_USERNAME = "example@qq.com"
PLEX_PASSWORD = "password"

# Plex API URL
LOGIN_URL = "https://plex.tv/users/sign_in.json"
PLEX_SERVER_BASEURL = "http://192.168.3.6:32400"  # æ›¿æ¢ä¸ºä½ çš„ Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨ URL

# ç™»å½•è¯·æ±‚çš„å¤´ä¿¡æ¯
HEADERS = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
    "X-Plex-Client-Identifier": "MyPlexApp"
}

# è·å–æ–°ä»¤ç‰Œçš„ç™»å½•è¯·æ±‚æ•°æ®
data = {
    "user": {
        "login": PLEX_USERNAME,
        "password": PLEX_PASSWORD
    }
}

def get_plex_token():
    """
    é€šè¿‡å‘ Plex API å‘é€ç™»å½•è¯·æ±‚è·å– Plex è®¤è¯ä»¤ç‰Œã€‚
    """
    try:
        response = requests.post(LOGIN_URL, headers=HEADERS, data=json.dumps(data))
        if response.status_code == 201:  # çŠ¶æ€ç  201 è¡¨ç¤ºç™»å½•æˆåŠŸ
            return response.json()['user']['authentication_token']
        else:
            print(f"è·å–ä»¤ç‰Œå¤±è´¥ã€‚çŠ¶æ€ç : {response.status_code}")
            return None
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"è®¤è¯è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")
        return None

def read_token_from_file(token_file):
    """
    ä»æŒ‡å®šçš„ JSON æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­è¯»å– Plex ä»¤ç‰Œã€‚
    """
    if os.path.exists(token_file):
        try:
            with open(token_file, 'r') as file:
                data = json.load(file)
                return data.get('token')
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"è¯»å–ä»¤ç‰Œæ–‡ä»¶æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")
            return None
    else:
        return None

def save_token_to_file(token_file, token):
    """
    å°† Plex ä»¤ç‰Œä¿å­˜åˆ°æŒ‡å®šçš„ JSON æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ã€‚
    """
    try:
        with open(token_file, 'w') as file:
            json.dump({"token": token}, file)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"ä¿å­˜ä»¤ç‰Œåˆ°æ–‡ä»¶æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")

def check_token_validity(baseurl, token):
    """
    é€šè¿‡å‘æœåŠ¡å™¨å‘é€éªŒè¯è¯·æ±‚æ¥æ£€æŸ¥ Plex ä»¤ç‰Œçš„æœ‰æ•ˆæ€§ã€‚
    """
    try:
        check_url = f"{baseurl}/library/sections?X-Plex-Token={token}"
        response = requests.get(check_url)
        return response.status_code == 200
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"æ£€æŸ¥ä»¤ç‰Œæœ‰æ•ˆæ€§æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")
        return False

def modify_port(plex, new_port):
    """
    ä¿®æ”¹ Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨è®¾ç½®ä¸­çš„æ‰‹åŠ¨ç«¯å£æ˜ å°„ã€‚
    """
    manual_port_setting = plex.settings.get('manualPortMappingPort')
    
    if manual_port_setting:
        try:
            manual_port_setting.set(new_port)
            plex.settings.save()
            print(f"æ‰‹åŠ¨ç«¯å£æ˜ å°„å·²æˆåŠŸæ›´æ”¹ä¸º: {new_port}")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"ä¿®æ”¹ç«¯å£æˆ–ä¿å­˜è®¾ç½®æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")
    else:
        print("æ— æ³•æ‰¾åˆ°æ‰‹åŠ¨ç«¯å£æ˜ å°„è®¾ç½®ã€‚")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # ç¬¬ä¸€æ­¥ï¼šè§£æå‘½ä»¤è¡Œå‚æ•°ï¼Œè·å–æ–°çš„ç«¯å£å·
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print("ç”¨æ³•: python3 modify.py <new_port>")
        sys.exit(1)

    try:
        NEW_PORT = int(sys.argv[1])  # å°†æä¾›çš„ç«¯å£å·è½¬æ¢ä¸ºæ•´æ•°
    except ValueError:
        print("æ— æ•ˆçš„ç«¯å£å·ã€‚è¯·æä¾›æœ‰æ•ˆçš„æ•´æ•°ã€‚")
        sys.exit(1)

    # ç¬¬äºŒæ­¥ï¼šå®šä¹‰ä»¤ç‰Œå­˜å‚¨æ–‡ä»¶
    TOKEN_FILE = "/root/plex_token.json"  # Token è·¯å¾„

    # ç¬¬ä¸‰æ­¥ï¼šä»æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­è¯»å–ä»¤ç‰Œæˆ–ç”Ÿæˆæ–°ä»¤ç‰Œ
    PLEX_TOKEN = read_token_from_file(TOKEN_FILE)

    # ç¬¬å››æ­¥ï¼šå¦‚æœæ–‡ä»¶ä¸­æ²¡æœ‰ä»¤ç‰Œï¼Œæˆ–è€…ä»¤ç‰Œæ— æ•ˆï¼Œåˆ™ç”Ÿæˆæ–°ä»¤ç‰Œ
    if PLEX_TOKEN is None or not check_token_validity(PLEX_SERVER_BASEURL, PLEX_TOKEN):
        PLEX_TOKEN = get_plex_token()
        if PLEX_TOKEN:
            save_token_to_file(TOKEN_FILE, PLEX_TOKEN)
        else:
            print("è·å–æœ‰æ•ˆä»¤ç‰Œå¤±è´¥ã€‚")
            sys.exit(1)

    # ç¬¬äº”æ­¥ï¼šä½¿ç”¨ plexapi è¿æ¥åˆ° Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨å¹¶ä¿®æ”¹æ‰‹åŠ¨ç«¯å£
    try:
        plex = PlexServer(PLEX_SERVER_BASEURL, PLEX_TOKEN)
        print("æˆåŠŸè¿æ¥åˆ° Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼")
        
        # ä¿®æ”¹æ‰‹åŠ¨ç«¯å£æ˜ å°„ï¼ˆä½¿ç”¨ä¼ å…¥çš„ç«¯å£å·ï¼‰
        modify_port(plex, NEW_PORT)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"è¿æ¥ Plex æœåŠ¡å™¨æˆ–ä¿®æ”¹è®¾ç½®æ—¶å‘ç”Ÿé”™è¯¯: {str(e)}")

Lucky é…ç½®

åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ª TCP ç©¿é€è§„åˆ™ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œæˆ‘æŒ‡å®šäº†ä¸€ä¸ªç©ºé—²ç«¯å£ä¸º 13333 ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”ä¸ä½¿ç”¨ LUCKY çš„å†…ç½®ç«¯å£è½¬å‘ã€‚å¼€å¯è‡ªå®šä¹‰è„šæœ¬è§¦å‘ï¼Œä»£ç å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

python3 /root/modify_port.py ${port}

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then

import { routesConfig } from './config';

/**

 * routesConfig è¦æ»¡è¶³ RouteConfig ç±»å‹çº¦æŸ

3.1.2 ç»„ä»¶å¤–è·³è½¬

react-router åªæä¾›äº†ç»„ä»¶å†…è·³è½¬è·¯ç”±çš„ api useNavigateã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬è¿˜å¸Œæœ›åœ¨ç»„ä»¶å¤–å¯ä»¥è·³è½¬ã€‚è€Œ history æ˜¯ä¸“é—¨åšè¿™ä¸ªäº‹æƒ…çš„ å¦ä¸€æ–¹é¢ï¼Œreact-router æ²¡æœ‰æä¾› history æ¨¡å¼çš„ Router ç»„ä»¶ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦å°è£…ä¸€ä¸ª

// history.ts
import { createBrowserHistory } from 'history';
const history = createBrowserHistory();
export default history;

// HistoryRouter.tsx
import { useState, useLayoutEffect } from 'react';
import { Router } from 'react-router-dom';
import type { BrowserHistory } from 'history';

export interface HistoryRouterProps {
  history: BrowserHistory
  basename?: string
  children?: React.ReactNode
}

export default function HistoryRouter({
  basename,
  children,
  history,
}: HistoryRouterProps) {
  const [state, setState] = useState({
    action: history.action,
    location: history.location,
  });

  useLayoutEffect(() => history.listen(setState), [history]);

  return (
    <Router
      basename={basename}
      location={state.location}
      navigationType={state.action}
      navigator={history}
    >
      { children }
    </Router>
  );
}
